Description: Corner of textile (mantle/curtain?) in red wool plain weave with decoration of parallel bands made in pink wool; one selvedge is preserved and is reinforced on three warps, warp is grouped by 4; one finishing border is preservedand the red wool warp finishes in a twisted fringe (c.4cm long); c.5mm above the fringe there is supplementary weft in pink wool, and every 2.5cm one thread comes out to hold a tassle made of grouped, undyed linen threads (11 tassles remaining); other edges cut and ragged; plain weave: warp-red wool (S/12), weft-red wool (S/17); tapestry on paired threads: warp-red wool (S/7), weft-pink? wool (S/36); supplementary weft-pink wool (S spun Z ply)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
